metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0494 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This issue occurs due to a danglingpointer in DeepCopyPointerClasses that can be exploited byProcXkbSetDeviceInfo() and ProcXkbGetDeviceInfo() to read and write intofreed memory. This can lead to local privilege elevation on systems wherethe X server runs privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xdmx-tools - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xnest - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xorg-server-source - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-common - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
xvfb - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
